title: Space Elevator Control Room Adventure #54
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Main Control Room
rooms.description: A high-tech command center with curved walls of monitors displaying Earth far below and the tether stretching into space above. Warning lights flash red across multiple consoles. The hum of machinery fills the air. Through the reinforced viewport, you can see the curvature of Earth and the blackness of space. Emergency protocols have been activated.

items.name: primary control console
items.description: The central command station with multiple screens showing system diagnostics and alerts
items.text: SYSTEM ALERT: Critical malfunction detected in tether stabilization. Facility established 2089. Chief Engineer Rodriguez has initiated emergency protocols. All personnel must evacuate via escape pods.

items.name: operations desk
items.description: A workstation covered with tablets and status reports

items.name: shift log tablet
items.description: A digital tablet with the current shift information
items.text: Shift Log - Station Commander: Chief Engineer Rodriguez. Systems Analyst: Dr. Kim. The secure drawer code is the year this facility became operational: 2089. Engineering Bay access requires proper authorization.

items.name: engineering access card
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled ENGINEERING BAY ACCESS

items.name: status wall monitor
items.description: A large display showing facility schematics and system status
items.text: FACILITY STATUS: Tether integrity at 45% and falling. Engineering Bay contains emergency repair tools. Escape pods located in Pod Bay Delta. Chief Engineer Rodriguez authorized for all emergency procedures.

items.name: emergency equipment locker
items.description: A red locker marked with safety symbols

items.name: emergency flashlight
items.description: A heavy-duty flashlight for emergency situations

items.name: emergency procedures guide
items.description: A laminated card with evacuation instructions
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION: Proceed to Engineering Bay to assess damage. Gather necessary tools and data. Access escape pods in Pod Bay Delta. Authorization required: verify station commander identity and facility location.

items.name: supply cabinet
items.description: A metal cabinet with various supplies and equipment

items.name: emergency protein bar
items.description: Sealed emergency rations

items.name: engineering bay door
items.description: A reinforced door with a card reader and warning stripes. It leads to the Engineering Bay.

rooms.name: Engineering Bay
rooms.description: A spacious workshop filled with diagnostic equipment, tool racks, and repair stations. Cables and conduits run along the ceiling. The tether monitoring station shows critical stress readings. Spare parts and components are organized in labeled bins. A sealed door leads to the escape pod bay.

items.name: tether diagnostic station
items.description: A specialized console monitoring the space elevator tether
items.text: TETHER ANALYSIS: Structural failure imminent. Cause: micrometeorite impact at 35000km altitude. Repair impossible from this location. Immediate evacuation required. This station orbits at geosynchronous altitude above the Pacific Ocean.

items.name: engineering tool rack
items.description: A wall-mounted rack with various tools and equipment

items.name: engineering multitool
items.description: A versatile tool with multiple functions

items.name: main workbench
items.description: A large workbench with drawers and a locked toolbox

items.name: facility technical manual
items.description: A comprehensive manual for station operations
items.text: FACILITY OVERVIEW: Space Elevator Station Gamma, established 2089. Location: Geosynchronous orbit above Pacific Ocean. Station Commander: Chief Engineer Rodriguez. Emergency escape pods provide re-entry capability for all personnel.

items.name: emergency override key
items.description: A physical key for emergency systems bypass

items.name: personnel assignment board
items.description: A digital display showing crew assignments and photos
items.text: CURRENT CREW: Chief Engineer Rodriguez - Station Commander, all emergency authority. Dr. Kim - Systems Analyst. Tech Martinez - Maintenance. Location: Pacific Ocean geosynchronous orbit.

items.name: spare parts bin
items.description: A container with various replacement components

items.name: diagnostic data chip
items.description: A chip containing critical system data

items.name: escape pod bay door
items.description: A heavy blast door with security panel. Three verification questions are displayed on the screen.

password_questions.question: Who is the station commander?
password_questions.hint: Check the shift log and personnel board

password_questions.question: Where is this facility located?
password_questions.hint: The technical manual and diagnostic station mention the location

password_questions.question: What year was this facility established?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents reference the establishment date

rooms.name: Escape Pod Bay Delta
rooms.description: You have reached the escape pod bay! A row of sleek emergency escape pods line the curved wall, their hatches open and ready. Status lights glow green on the nearest pod. Through the launch tube window, you can see Earth rotating slowly below. The pod systems hum with power, ready to carry you safely home.

items.name: emergency escape pod
items.description: A streamlined re-entry vehicle with heat shielding and parachute systems

items.name: launch control panel
items.description: The pod launch system showing all green indicators
items.text: ESCAPE POD STATUS: All systems nominal. Re-entry trajectory calculated. Destination: Pacific Ocean recovery zone. Launch sequence ready.

items.name: observation viewport
items.description: A reinforced window showing the view of Earth below

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You climb into the escape pod and seal the hatch. The launch sequence initiates automatically. With a sudden thrust, the pod separates from the failing space elevator station and begins its controlled descent toward Earth. Through the window, you watch the station grow smaller as you fall safely toward the blue planet below. You have escaped the doomed facility and will soon be recovered from the Pacific Ocean. You win!
